articles.author: Richa Naidu
articles.description: Bayer (BAYGn.DE) is a "conglomerate" that needs to make major changes including "de-merging" two of its three business arms, investor Artisan Partners told Reuters on Friday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Bayer investor Artisan calls for break up

articles.author: Lewis Krauskopf, Chibuike Oguh, Lance Tupper
articles.description: Nvidia's (NVDA.O) move to buy back $25 billion of its shares after its stock has more than tripled this year caught some investors off-guard, even as they cheered a stellar second-quarter report.
articles.title: Nvidia's $25 billion buyback 'a head-scratcher' for some shareholders

articles.author: Ellen Zhang, Marius Zaharia
articles.description: Erin Yao would like to take street dance classes and travel, activities she could not do during three years of COVID-19 restrictions in China.
articles.title: China has no pain-free solutions for its slowing economy

articles.author: Joseph White, David Shepardson, Shivansh Tiwary
articles.description: The United Auto Workers (UAW) union on Friday said members voted overwhelmingly in favor of authorizing a strike at the Detroit Three automakers if agreement is not reached before the current four-year contract expires on Sept. 14.
articles.title: UAW votes overwhelmingly to authorize strike at Detroit Three automakers

articles.author: Daniel Wiessner
articles.description: A new lawsuit accusing SpaceX of illegally refusing to hire asylum recipients and refugees could be an important test of the U.S. government's stance that national security concerns do not allow companies to discriminate against non-citizens.
articles.title: SpaceX lawsuit could be key test of US policy on bias against refugees

articles.author: Helen Coster, Greg Bensinger
articles.description: Investment firm Tiger Global Management LLC, known for its early bets on tech firms like Meta (META.O) and Spotify , on Friday told limited partners it was targeted in a series of misinformation attacks by a former employee, according to a letter seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Tiger Global says ex-employee targets it in misinformation attacks

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: The death of an airline employee in December and another serious injury prompted the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to issue a safety alert on Friday to airlines in an effort to prevent more incidents.
articles.title: Worker death prompts US FAA to issue aviation ground safety alert

articles.author: Jason Lange
articles.description: Donald Trump leads Ron DeSantis by nearly 40 percentage points in the race for the Republican presidential nomination even after declining to debate the Florida governor and other rivals, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll that closed on Friday.
articles.title: Trump still dominates, no DeSantis bounce from Republican debate, Reuters/Ipsos poll shows

articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.description: Inflation has been falling. The unemployment rate is a low 3.5%. The U.S. economy has avoided a threatened banking crisis and financial markets have not only aligned with the Federal Reserve's tight-credit policies but of late even helped the process by bidding up market interest rates.
articles.title: As Fed registers gains, Powell may take a lay low approach

articles.author: Boureima Balima, Moussa Aksar
articles.description: Niger's junta, which seized power in a coup on July 26, said on Friday it had ordered French ambassador Sylvain Itte to leave the country within 48 hours, as relations between the West African country and its former colonial ruler deteriorated further.
articles.title: Niger junta expels French ambassador
